And Ahab had said to Obadiah, “Go into the land to all the springs of water and to all the brooks; perhaps we may find grass to keep the horses and mules alive, so that we will not have to kill any livestock.”
So they divided the land between them to explore it; Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.
Now as Obadiah was on his way, suddenly Elijah met him; and he recognized him, and fell on his face, and said, “ that you, my lord Elijah?”
And he answered him, “ I. Go, tell your master, ‘Elijah ’ ”
So he said, “How have I sinned, that you are delivering your servant into the hand of Ahab, to kill me?

So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him; and Ahab went to meet Elijah.
Then it happened, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said to him, “ you, O troubler of Israel?”
And he answered, “I have not troubled Israel, but you and your father’s house  in that you have forsaken the commandments of the  and have followed the Baals.

Elijah’s Mount Carmel Victory
So Ahab sent for all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together on Mount Carmel.
And Elijah came to all the people, and said, “How long will you falter between two opinions? If the   God, follow Him; but if Baal, follow him.” But the people answered him not a word.
Then Elijah said to the people, “I alone am left a prophet of the ; but Baal’s prophets  four hundred and fifty men.

Then you call on the name of your gods, and I will call on the name of the ; and the God who answers by fire, He is God.”So all the people answered and said, “It is well spoken.”
Now Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, “Choose one bull for yourselves and prepare  first, for you  many; and call on the name of your god, but put no fire ”

So they took the bull which was given them, and they prepared  and called on the name of Baal from morning even till noon, saying, “O Baal, hear us!” But  no voice; no one answered. Then they leaped about the altar which they had made.
And so it was, at noon, that Elijah mocked them and said, “Cry aloud, for he  a god; either he is meditating, or he is busy, or he is on a journey,  perhaps he is sleeping and must be awakened.”
So they cried aloud, and cut themselves, as was their custom, with knives and lances, until the blood gushed out on them.

Then Elijah said to all the people, “Come near to me.” So all the people came near to him. And he repaired the altar of the   broken down.

So the water ran all around the altar; and he also filled the trench with water.

The Drought Ends
Then Elijah said to Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink; for  the sound of abundance of rain.”
So Ahab went up to eat and drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; then he bowed down on the ground, and put his face between his knees,
and said to his servant, “Go up now, look toward the sea.”So he went up and looked, and said, “ nothing.” And seven times he said, “Go again.”

Then it came to pass the seventh  that he said, “There is a cloud, as small as a man’s hand, rising out of the sea!” So he said, “Go up, say to Ahab, ‘Prepare  and go down before the rain stops you.’ ”
Now it happened in the meantime that the sky became black with clouds and wind, and there was a heavy rain. So Ahab rode away and went to Jezreel.
Then the hand of the  came upon Elijah; and he girded up his loins and ran ahead of Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
